page.title: 09GOLF CLUB, BRACKNELL.
page.content: The three hundred and sixty acres which comprise the{Berkshire Golf} {Courses}was all once part of Windsor Forest. That is until around 1817 and the Enclosure Acts. This area then became{Crown Estate}land. Between the Wars few houses were built in this area, then with the post-1945 Town and Country Planning Acts it was designated{"Green Belt"}and so protected from any major development. Plans for a{Golf Club}in this area were laid in 1920 and the course and club were opened in 1928. The{geology}of this area includes Bagshot Sand upon London Clay, which provides a natural habitat for Scots Pine, Silver Birch, Oak and Spanish Chestnut.
